sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Schedule Task Creation From Env Variable Or Potentially Suspicious Path Via Schtasks.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Schtask creations that point to a suspicious folder or an environment variable often used by malware

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=MD5=478BEAEC1C3A9417272BC8964ADD1CEE,SHA256=9A121ACF7686D2883E524332111D5E4BCC0C1A8E81136486FBA4CA65CA614407,IMPHASH=918DBB01101BFA7F1042CCA9520D2A05; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\MSBuild.exe; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe" /create /f /sc minute /mo 1 /tn "MSBuild" /tr "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\MSBuild.exe"; FileVersion=10.0.19041.906 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\MSBuild.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=SHA1=BBE6394229CE3A53ECCD2CB4CEA6EE41134EFDA9,MD5=15FF7D8324231381BAD48A052F85DF04,SHA256=7949EDDF437FED5F45564402B26E4D457EA666D1361A7C4F07D830BE233A4F72,IMPHASH=FC93D9248DEA161B2E724C188AECD07D; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\MSBuild.exe; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe" /create /f /sc minute /mo 1 /tn "MSBuild" /tr "C:\Users\george\AppData\Roaming\MSBuild.exe"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\MSBuild.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.
Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=MD5=478BEAEC1C3A9417272BC8964ADD1CEE,SHA256=9A121ACF7686D2883E524332111D5E4BCC0C1A8E81136486FBA4CA65CA614407,IMPHASH=918DBB01101BFA7F1042CCA9520D2A05; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\MSBuild.exe; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe" /create /f /sc minute /mo 1 /tn "MSBuild" /tr "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\MSBuild.exe"; FileVersion=10.0.19041.906 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\MSBuild.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=BBE6394229CE3A53ECCD2CB4CEA6EE41134EFDA9,MD5=15FF7D8324231381BAD48A052F85DF04,SHA256=7949EDDF437FED5F45564402B26E4D457EA666D1361A7C4F07D830BE233A4F72,IMPHASH=FC93D9248DEA161B2E724C188AECD07D; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\MSBuild.exe; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe" /create /f /sc minute /mo 1 /tn "MSBuild" /tr "C:\Users\george\AppData\Roaming\MSBuild.exe"; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\MSBuild.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: (http_inspect) HTTP response has UTF character set that failed to normalize
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ( gid:119; sid:104; rev:3; msg:"(http_inspect) HTTP response has UTF character set that failed to normalize"; metadata: policy max-detect-ips drop, rule-type preproc; classtype:unknown;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET USER_AGENTS Microsoft Device Metadata Retrieval Client User-Agent
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET USER_AGENTS Microsoft Device Metadata Retrieval Client User-Agent"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"MICROSOFT_DEVICE_METADATA_RETRIEVAL_CLIENT"; depth:42; endswith; nocase; fast_pattern; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2027390; rev:4; metadata:affected_product Web_Browsers, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2019_05_28, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2020_09_17;)
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Echo Reply"; icode:0; itype:0; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:408; rev:8; )
